text: The platform 's architecture should be considered with the potential for future integrations with existing enterprise resource planning ( ERP ) and customer relationship management ( CRM ) systems , as these are frequently integral to B2B operations.2The primary audience for this document is the software development team tasked with the responsibility of building and implementing the B2B billing platform .

Secondary audiences include project managers , who will use this document to plan and track the progress of the development lifecycle , and business analysts , who were involved in the initial requirement gathering and will continue to validate the developed features against these specifications .

In the event of external procurement , potential vendors will also use this SRS to understand the requirements and assess their ability to provide a suitable solution.1 Given the diverse nature of this audience , the language used throughout this document aims to strike a balance between technical precision for the development team and clarity for business - oriented stakeholders .

Entitlement: The specific rights, permissions, and usage allowances granted to a subscriber based on the particular subscription plan and tier they have selected.3
Usage Metric: A clearly defined and quantifiable measure that tracks the consumption of a particular service or resource by a subscriber over a given period.4
Aggregation Interval: The specific duration or period over which the platform accumulates usage data for the purpose of calculating billing charges.5
Threshold Alert: An automated notification that is triggered by the system when a subscriber's usage of a particular metric reaches or exceeds a predefined limit.6
Invoice: A formal commercial document issued by the platform to a subscriber, detailing the charges incurred for the services rendered or goods provided during a specified billing period.7
Locale: A set of linguistic and cultural conventions that define the user's preferred language, regional formats for data display (such as dates and numbers), and currency preferences.8

Subscription & Tier ManagementThe platform must provide comprehensive capabilities for managing various subscription plans and their associated tiers, allowing businesses to structure their offerings in a flexible and scalable manner.

The platform should enable administrators to create and manage a diverse range of subscription plans , each identified by a unique name , a detailed description outlining its benefits , and a selectable billing frequency , such as monthly , quarterly , or annual cycles .
manage a diverse range of subscription plans

Furthermore , the system must accommodate different pricing models to suit various service offerings , including flat - rate pricing where a fixed fee is charged per billing cycle , usage - based pricing where charges are directly proportional to the consumption of services , and tiered pricing where different usage levels or feature sets are offered at varying price points.11 A fundamental requirement is the ability to associate a base price with each subscription plan and to define clear and configurable rules for the automatic generation of recurring billing charges.7 The flexibility in defining these pricing models is paramount for catering to the diverse needs of B2B interactions and for aligning with different revenue generation strategies .
to define clear and configurable rules for the automatic generation of recurring billing
The platform’s underlying architecture should be designed to easily accommodate the creation of new pricing models and the modification of existing ones as business needs evolve.

The platform must include a robust mechanism for administrators to define , meticulously track , and rigorously enforce these entitlements for each individual subscriber throughout their subscription lifecycle.3
rigorously enforce these entitlements for each individual subscriber throughout their subscription
The platform must facilitate seamless and intuitive upgrade and downgrade processes for subscribers.

Users should have the ability to modify their current subscription plan or tier at any point during their active billing cycle.14 When a plan change occurs , the system must automatically calculate and apply any necessary pro - rated charges or credits to the subscriber 's account to reflect the partial billing periods .
apply any necessary pro - rated charges or credits to the subscriber 's account to reflect the partial billing periods

Upon the successful completion of an upgrade or downgrade , the system should generate and send timely notifications to both the subscriber and the platform administrator , ensuring transparency and keeping all relevant parties informed .
send timely notifications to both the subscriber and the platform administrator , ensuring transparency and keeping all relevant parties informed
keeping all relevant parties informed
To support customer acquisition and platform adoption, the platform should offer comprehensive free trial management capabilities for various subscription plans.

Administrators should have the flexibility to configure key aspects of the free trial, such as its duration, the specific features that are accessible during the trial period, and whether or not credit card details are required from the user at the outset.15 The system should automatically send timely reminders to users as their free trial period is nearing its end, encouraging conversion to a paid subscription.

Furthermore, a clear and straightforward process must be in place to seamlessly transition free trial users to paid subscribers upon their decision to continue using the platform.17 Effective management of free trials, incorporating elements like clear expectations and proactive engagement, is a proven strategy for B2B SaaS businesses to attract and convert potential customers.

Dynamic Usage MeteringThe platform must possess robust capabilities for dynamically measuring and recording the consumption of services by subscribers , enabling flexible and accurate usage - based billing models .

the number of transactions processed.4
The underlying data collection mechanisms must be inherently reliable and ensure a high degree of accuracy to guarantee fair and transparent billing practices.4
The platform's design should allow for the seamless integration of new metrics as the service offerings evolve, without requiring significant modifications to the core system.
The platform should provide the flexibility to define different aggregation intervals for the collected usage metrics, such as hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly.5
The system must then accurately aggregate the recorded usage data over these specified intervals to facilitate precise billing calculations.5

This configurability allows the platform to adapt to various billing scenarios, where some services might be billed based on short-term, high-intensity usage, while others are based on cumulative consumption over longer periods.
empower subscribers to manage their usage effectively

To enhance transparency and empower subscribers to manage their usage effectively , the platform must support the configuration of threshold alerts for the defined usage metrics.6 Subscribers should have the ability to set up personalized alerts that notify them when their usage approaches or exceeds predefined limits .
exceeds predefined limits
Automated InvoicingThe platform must incorporate robust features for the automated generation and delivery of invoices , streamlining the billing cycle and reducing manual effort .
reducing manual effort

The platform should support the automated generation of invoices based on highly configurable schedules , such as monthly or quarterly cycles , or triggered by specific events like reaching a predefined usage threshold.19 Different billing frequencies should be supported to align with the various subscription plans offered .
triggered by specific events like reaching a predefined usage threshold.19
Different billing frequencies should be supported to align with the various subscription plans offered .
Furthermore, the system must provide the capability to generate ad-hoc invoices whenever necessary, such as for one-time charges or adjustments.

All invoices generated by the platform must be in Portable Document Format (PDF) to ensure easy sharing, printing, and a consistent professional appearance.21 The PDF format of the invoice should include all essential billing information, such as the specific billing period covered, a clear and itemized list of the services rendered or the usage incurred, the corresponding quantities or durations, the unit prices for each item, the total amount due, the applicable payment terms, and the complete contact details for both the customer and the vendor.22

The platform should also allow for a degree of customization of the invoice template, enabling businesses to incorporate their company branding elements, such as logos, to maintain a consistent brand identity across all customer communications.

The platform must support multiple channels for the delivery of invoices to customers, including electronic mail (email) and the option for customers to directly download their invoices from a secure self-service portal.23 For email delivery, the system should offer configurable options for sending invoices either as direct attachments or as secure links to the invoice document.
To ensure reliable delivery, the platform should track delivery confirmations whenever possible.

A self - service portal empowers customers to access their billing history and current invoices at their convenience , reducing the need for direct inquiries and improving overall customer satisfaction.5 . The system should automatically convert prices from the base currency to the customer 's selected currency based on predefined exchange rates.29 To ensure accuracy , the platform should allow for the configuration of rules governing the update of these exchange rates , such as setting a frequency for updates ( e.g. , daily ) or integrating with specific third - party exchange rate providers.31 Supporting multi - currency billing is essential for businesses with a global customer base , as it simplifies international transactions and enhances the customer experience .
integrating with specific third - party exchange rate providers.31
enhances the customer experience
The platform should accommodate different locale formats for the display of dates, numbers, and currencies based on the customer's geographical region.8
All customer-facing documents generated by the platform, including invoice PDFs, should automatically adhere to the locale format selected by the customer.

The platform must accurately calculate applicable taxes based on the customer 's location and the relevant tax regulations , such as Value Added Tax ( VAT ) or Goods and Services Tax ( GST).25 This requires the ability to configure different tax rates and rules for various geographical regions and jurisdictions .
This requires the ability to configure different tax rates and rules for various geographical regions and jurisdictions .
The system should automatically determine the correct tax rates based on the customer 's billing address and apply these taxes to the invoice total .
apply these taxes to the invoice total

Furthermore , the platform should provide support for handling tax exemptions , including the ability to manage and validate tax exemption certificates provided by customers.25 Accurate tax calculation and adherence to local tax laws are critical for B2B transactions , especially in international commerce , to ensure compliance and avoid potential legal issues.6 .
validate
avoid potential legal issues.6
Fraud DetectionThe platform must incorporate robust mechanisms for detecting and mitigating fraudulent activities , ensuring the security and integrity of the billing process .
mitigating fraudulent activities
The platform should implement anomaly detection logic to proactively identify potentially fraudulent activities within

This logic should involve the continuous monitoring of various parameters and the identification of unusual patterns or deviations from expected behavior, such as significant increases in transaction volumes, inconsistencies between billing addresses and IP addresses, multiple consecutive failed payment attempts, or unauthorized modifications to account details.37

The platform should ideally leverage machine learning techniques to build predictive models that can learn from historical data and identify subtle indicators of fraudulent behavior.40 This proactive approach to fraud detection is crucial for minimizing financial losses and protecting both the platform and its legitimate users from malicious activities .
identify subtle indicators of fraudulent behavior.40 This proactive approach to fraud detection
protecting both the platform and its legitimate users from malicious activities
Upon the detection of a potential anomaly, the platform must generate timely alerts.9
The system should support different severity levels for alerts, allowing administrators to prioritize investigations based on the perceived risk associated with the flagged activity.

The platform should provide well-defined workflows and tools to facilitate the investigation of potentially fraudulent activities.48 This includes providing administrators with access to detailed transaction histories, comprehensive user activity logs, and relevant payment information associated with the flagged anomaly.

The system should also allow administrators to take necessary actions , such as marking transactions or accounts as fraudulent , temporarily suspending user accounts , or reversing suspicious transactions .
temporarily suspending user accounts , or reversing suspicious transactions
reversing suspicious transactions
Reporting & Analytics APIThe platform must provide a comprehensive Reporting & Analytics API that allows authorized users to access valuable data insights for business analysis and decision-making.

The API should include dedicated endpoints for retrieving various revenue reports , such as total revenue generated over specific periods , detailed breakdowns of recurring revenue ( MRR ) , revenue generated by different subscription plans , and trends in revenue growth over time.10 These endpoints should support flexible filtering options , allowing users to narrow down the data based on specific date ranges , selected subscription plans , defined customer segments , and transaction currency .

revenue generated by different subscription plans , and trends in revenue growth over time.10 These endpoints should support flexible filtering options , allowing users to narrow down the data based on specific date ranges , selected subscription plans , defined customer segments , and transaction currency

The API should also provide endpoints for accessing usage summaries for individual subscribers, allowing users to view their consumption of various platform metrics over different timeframes.56 These endpoints should support filtering by specific customer accounts, selected subscription plans, and defined date ranges.

The returned usage summaries should include aggregated consumption data for the relevant metrics and should ideally highlight any instances where a subscriber 's usage has exceeded predefined thresholds.4
should ideally highlight any instances where a subscriber 's usage has exceeded

To enhance the utility of the reporting API , it must support the export of report data in several common formats , including Comma Separated Values ( CSV ) , Microsoft Excel ( XLS / XLSX ) , and potentially JavaScript Object Notation ( JSON).57 This flexibility allows users to analyze the data using their preferred external tools and to seamlessly integrate the billing data with other internal business systems.1
This flexibility allows users to analyze the data using their preferred external tools and to seamlessly integrate the billing data with other internal business systems.1
The API must ensure the integrity and security of the data throughout the export process.
Supporting multiple export formats ensures that the reporting API is accessible and useful to a wide range of users with varying technical capabilities and data analysis preferences.
